author: muesliswap
title: A standard for token verification
description: Fake or scam projects are a common cause of concern. Scammers mint fake tokens that mimic tokens from popular and legit projects and trick users into buying them.

f6_assessments.q0: There is a large number of fake tokens in the environment. IT is technically involved to verify that the token belongs to a particular project. The minting policy is also difficult to interpret. There is a large number of services to verify these policies and identify the projects. The proposal is to build an open common standard for token verification. The MuesliSwap who is the proposer is also committing to support continuous hosting by charging a fee. The proposal does not include the exact modality of how the proposal will be implemented however the end state to be achieved is very clear. The trust and the comfort of the crypto ecosystem need to be improved drastically to make the environment safe for not too tech-savvy people. This proposal is very much aiding this idea and therefore it is very much aligned with the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: MuesliSwap is a successful running DEX in Cardano and has a strong user base. The same team had proposed the idea and has committed to supporting it with extra money if required. Also, the Cardano Defi alliance can greatly influence the adoption of a common standard which is required to make the complete ecosystem secure. With these credentials and the clarity of the proposal, it is not difficult to assess that the proposal will be implemented in right earnest.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal is for 22K USD and the project is expected to be developed in a month. The details of the cost breakdown are 10000USD for 100 hours of development including the creation of API endpoints and hosting of a server. That translates to 100 USD per hour for development. The cost also includes 10K USD for Maintenance and for supporting the server. 2K USD for community outreach. The cost for these activities is slightly on the higher side considering that there will be some revenue once the service is online and the community has accepted it. However, the complete standard is promised as open and the benefits that will be available to the community in terms of security are likely to be much more. WIth this consideration, it can be said that the project is fair in terms of cost and is highly auditable.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal provides a very important impact to the Cardano Ecosystem. Which is security. The proposal aims to protect users from scam token, by creating a platform that has a verification token. This is in my opinion very beneficial to the community. Too many scam cases are happening and this proposal further enhances the security in Cardano. Thus with that this proposal effectively addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: The team behind the proposal is solid and has a working product (MuesliSwap) which is being used by many of us. I have full confidence in their team to execute this project. The timeline and cost breakdown is listed and the information provided is reasonable and achievable. The risks are listed as well with mitigation plans in place. However I can't help but feel how reliable is the verification information. Would there be a risk where is the verification token is inaccurate? I hope the team would take this into account as this is a very good proposal to the Cardano community. All in all, a feasible proposal and I believe it is highly likely this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: There are clear milestones and deliverables listed. The proposal did mentioned that any updates would be shares thru their social media channels. The proposal is very transparent as we can track the progress thru their website and Git repo. Key indicators/metric are included in this proposal, however more details would be appreciated. Overall the information provided is sufficient to audit the progress and the success of the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: This can become a huge problem in the early ecosystem of Cardano. In any new blockchain ecosystem, there will always be lots of random projects minting random coins or as described in this proposal, creating mimic coins of other legit projects. This can trick early users of Cardano into buying a scam coin. With this new standard for token verification, it can prevent these malicious creators from harming early members. One of the worst things would be a new member of Cardano to get tricked into buying a new coin and it being a scam. This proposal addresses this challenge by creating a new standard where projects will have to verify with the Muesliswap team in order for their token to be traded on their dex. I would hope this would be included with other dex's as well. For this reason, I give this section 5 out of 5 stars.
f6_assessments.q1: The team at Muesliswap has been around the early ecosystem for a while now. They are one of the bigger projects and have successfully created a great project. They have a large community that will likely help them to stay accountable to this token verification process. Their detailed roadmap gives a great visual on the things they have accomplished and how they plan of completing this token verification process. There is a timeframe of around 2 months to get it all completed. Having this time frame is important because it is a suggested date that they can be held accountable for. This typically is a great indicator of how likely the proposal will be implemented successfully. The plan will likely be successful because there is a great importance when it comes to verification and security in the blockchain. For these reasons, I give this section 5 stars.
f6_assessments.q2: There is a lot of information in the proposal while remaining concise and straight to the point. The team understands what is required for this proposal to be useful to the community. They have a very descriptive budget breakdown that shows exactly where the potential funds will be going and how much will be allocated to certain areas. This is crucial to the success of the proposal because it will help readers see the exact plan and to hold them accountable and make sure that those potential funds are allocated to where they are suggested in the proposal. I am led to believe that a standard for token verification will be huge for the community and will lead to a greater experience for all users on Cardano. For these reasons. I give this section 5 stars.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposers have raised a serious concern that we 'll faced one way or another.  "Scammers mint fake tokens that mimic tokens from popular and legit projects and trick users into buying them".  To solve this problem they propose a verification standard that could be easily accessible by users and developers and protect the Cardano community from fake projects.  Basically, the proposers will develop a website with a transparent verification process that would be accessible by all projects building on Cardano.  On this website, projects will submit their tokens to be verified whereas developers and end users will use the website to learn, check, be informed or check for flagged, verified, or unknown tokens.  The KPIs meet those of the challenge as the proposal will add value to Cardano ecosystem since it will offer security to Cardano users and trust in using the Cardano blockchain.
f6_assessments.q1: The MuesliSwap development team that will work on this project consists of 9 experienced developers who have been with the Cardano community for a long time.  The team is well experienced on Cardano blockchain.  Links have been provided about the team as well as their past achievements.  The budget is reasonable for the tasks to be performed.  The proposers clearly provided the tasks, the working hours per task and the cost per task, but they have not specified how many people will work on a specific task.  The proposers will not ask for additional funding for this specific project.  The timeline is reasonable and has  short duration.  A risk that the proposers foresee is the low adoption which will be tackled by introducing the project in the Cardano DeFi Alliance.
f6_assessments.q2: The community will be able to monitor the progress of the project through the website the proposers will develop as well as on social media.  Furthermore, the repository related to the verification will be open source therefore, everyone can check the progress.  KPIs are aligned with the implementation process and deliverables.

f6_assessments.q0: Nowadays, fake or scam projects are a common cause of concern. The proposal will address the challenge of protecting the Cardano community from fake projects and building a verification standard. The proposer explained in detail how the verification process worked. In the future, the proposer would extend this verification standard to all projects building on Cardano. From its functionality, this project is very useful for maintaining and strengthening the Cardano ecosystem. The proposer is confident that this will be a valuable service to the whole community of users and developers.
f6_assessments.q1: This project will be handled by the Muesli Swap development team. It currently consists of 9 developers with experience in different fields from which most are long-standing Cardano community members. The budget plan lacks detail and the overall budget is quite high compared with the total hours worked. This proposal didn't have a specific time plan to achieve the goals, their breakdown of the project was just a general program and considered too fast. The risk in this project is low adoption. The proposer has already submitted the solution, but it's too general. As an assessor, I couldn't give an exact solution due to their lack of a detailed roadmap and tasklists.
f6_assessments.q2: The roadmap and milestones for the project lack details. This is a huge blowback for this proposal. Fortunately, this project's metrics could be tracked through the website and social media provided by the proposer. The KPI target is focusing on how many users will use this system. My recommendation is the proposer should do promotions or work directly with the Cardano team so that this project can be carried out in a mandatory manner. Overall, this project has been described in sufficient detail. It's an interesting project but lacks solutions to attract developer enthusiasts to participate in the use of this verification standard.

solution: Establishing a verification standard that is easily accessible by users and developers and protects the Cardano community from fake projects.
experience: The team behind MuesliSwap, one of the biggest Decentralized Apps on Cardano. As developers of the DeFi infrastructure, we have experience with all relevant aspects of Cardano.
